<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module9_mcq_q17')" data-correct-answer="A">
<strong style="display: block;">What is the “free cash flow problem” in corporate finance?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q17" value="A"> A. Managers may use excess cash for unprofitable or self-serving projects.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q17" value="B"> B. Firms may fail to pay interest on time.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q17" value="C"> C. Shareholders prefer dividends to reinvestment.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q17" value="D"> D. Debt holders refuse to finance future projects.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module9_mcq_q17" value="E"> E. Firms pay excessive taxes on retained earnings.</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module9_mcq_q17" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ A is correct. The free cash flow problem arises when managers overinvest or misuse excess funds rather than returning them to shareholders.
